comment: I had Laven for Amer. Gov. last semester (Spring 2019). I think the biggest barrier for some people is the mandatory community service hours, where you do volunteer work and write about the experience, relating it to the topics discussed in class. Otherwise, the lectures were optional, and we got to talk about current events. It was a fun class.

Skipped literally almost every class and still ended with an A. Only a couple of short & easy papers and a 8-page paper final that was daunting, but still easy. Very nice professor, but his lectures weren't for me.

Professor was super chill, I barely showed up to class and got a B. No assignments, no projects. Just 3 different papers all turned in online. You can easily skip every single class, including the first day, and make an A in the class with minimal effort. Even has extra credit opportunities if for some reason you aren't content with your grade.
I really liked the class, I'm glad that I did the community service. In the end I learned a lot.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: It is too bad that Wim is leaving Kennesaw, he is the best instructor I've had, and KSU needs instructors like him. I really appreciated his commitment to student centered learning. I didn't even know what it was before his class. This was the first time I was in the driver seat of my education.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: He was an awesome teacher with great lectures! He made sure everyone was able to give their opinions! He does cuss often though so if that bothers you then you may not like him. His exams are essays that are open everything & you have plenty of time to do them!! Highly recommend!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Amazing lectures

comment: Totally in love with this class. I look forward to going and I've already learned so much.
Wim is hands down the most woke professor I've ever hand. He practices what he preaches, and he keeps it real.
Taking Wim's class was easy and entertaining, the only bad part was the final assignment where you write 6 pages on community service. One of your best professor choices for sure.

No homework? ... I'm confused by people who see reading assignments as optional. The class is easy enough, but there is work. You should do the reading, and you should the writing assignments before class. Future students: make sure you do the extra credit, it will probably make the difference between getting an A, or not getting an A. Just do it.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: He gives 3 writing assignments. Two 600 word essays and a 6 page final. The essays are about topics talked about in class. No homework, quizzes or tests. He does not take attendance. Class time is spent discussing our thoughts on government topic/ current events.

One of my favorite professor's I've ever taken!! He's a really cool guy and is super knowledgeable about a lot. Attendance isn't mandatory but his lectures are actually really cool to listen too. Class isn't too hard, 2 take home essays for tests and a community service paper. Pretty easy A if you put in effort , TAKE HIM, you won't regret it :)
Easiest class I have ever taken.

Take Wim!!! Charismatic and witty -- show up to class to enjoy that. No attendance log. Lenient grader. Forgiving of overdue work. Even teaches study habits. Completion of assignments and extra credit will get you an A. Three assignments: two take-home essay exams and one final project essay. You can even write your final paper early in the year.
rating_tags: SO MANY PAPERS--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Easy A, so many opportunities for extra credit. I enjoyed the class, we had real debates, and there were some good guest speakers. Biggest piece of advice start your final paper early. It is easy, but you'll get more out of it if you get to work early.

Good but also easy. I liked the community service project, he encouraged everyone to identify a passion and act on it. I thought that was really cool. This is the only gen ed class I found to actually be meaningful.

His class has been hilarious and we often discuss the topics we are learning in a globalized and practical manner before talking about the specific classroom applications. He gives take-home exams that account for a vast majority of your grade on top of a few papers and a community service project. Overall hes an amazing prof I would take again.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Hilarious--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Easy A. Had to do some work, but it was really easy. I took the class a while back and I'm only getting around to reviewing it now. Everyone was hyped because Donald Trump won, but he helped everyone see both sides. After that class I'm honestly not afraid to talk politics. It was really good.

I'm with the others who've posted he was my favorite. I saved this Gen. Ed. class to the end, trying to mix some easy classes into the mix with my upper division classes for the major (trust me on this strategy). Anyway, class was good. I joked that if I'd had it earlier I might have changed my major. I especially liked the project.

My favorite class. This was the only class I regularly showed up for because I really enjoyed it. Good honest debates. He lets everyone share their opinions and tells students that we'll learn more from each other than we learn from him. I've never gotten that kind of respect from a teacher before.

Be prepared to think. A lot of his lectures are about events around the world and some things are a little disturbing, but it is reality. There were three essays we had to do that were pretty much our entire grade. The last one is the final and tk get a great grade you should write 8-9 pages. He is a good professor and cares about his students.

Wim has by far been the weirdest professor i've had at KSU. You don't have to come to class, but if you do be ready for some strange and slightly intense debates. Only 3 grades in the whole class that were all essays. He grades pretty lax and gives a ton of extra credit. If you put in a little effort, it's an easy A.

By far the strangest class I've ever had, when I took this class all we would do is just talk about a topic he put on the board for a long time. Don't get me wrong, he's a pretty nifty dude. However, I feel as though more instruction would have been appreciated. I bet he lives in a small house though, it would make sense.

Felt more like a current issues class than an American government class. Instead of exams you have mini essays that require you to write about current events. The final is an 8 page essay on community service. His classes always ran late and you cant leave until he says so (which is difficult if you have a class on the other side of campus).

Wim is awesome. To be truthful, I was a little bit apprehensive about taking a Global Issues Class, especially with the current political climate. While Wim proudly labels himself a liberal snowflake (lol), he doesn't impose these views on the class. What he does do, is get the class to think and understand perspective.
Don't take this class, He makes you do volunteer work and right a essay on it like any one has time for that.
Great instructor! Great class! Had the whole class right in the syllabus. I was a big fan. Only criticism was students that didn't do the reading slowed the class down.

All you have to do is show up to class and write a couple papers. What a dream come true... Sorry, you do have to do a community service learning project and write about it. SO, just go to class, volunteer, and write a paper and some short essays that are generously graded. Easiest A I got last year. Your grade is up to you.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: My favorite class last year. Great discussion about important topics and lots of fun group work. I wish I had more classes like this.

Easy and fun. Basically there are three papers in the class. There are two take home exams, which are essay, and the assignments was given in the syllabus/first week. There is a paper for the final. You do a write-up on a volunteer project. He is a generous grader, really! It's an easy A.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Take this class, and take it from him. Most straightforward class I've ever taken.

I was in that class, and I have no idea why anyone would call it awful. It was easy and I liked it (except for a couple students). I'm so tired of seeing people post bad reviews, its probably someone who was lazy and didn't even try to meet with him. Definitely recommend this class and instructor when you take it.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Tests? Not many--Would take again

comment: Totally different from my high school classes. We had lots of class discussion and debate. He treated everyone with respect, I wish more students were the same way. It was the least stressful class I took this term, and I actually looked forward to it. I put off the volunteer project longer than I should have, but it was actually really easy.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Would take again

comment: Very enjoyable class! We covered a very broad range of important global issues and all the assignments were clear from day one. I was actually very surprised that the exams and final were posted in his syllabus, but I really liked that. Knowing the assignments in advance made it so easy to focus my note taking. I loved my volunteer experience too.

The class is primarily open discussion, which seemed to be really helpful for most students. Very laid back + very caring. His grading is very reasonable and there is more than enough time to complete the papers.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Caring

comment: I would not recommend taking this professor, unless you enjoy writing papers. Instead of exams you have to mini essays. Our final is a 7-8 page paper about our 8 hours of volunteer work (yes you have to do 8 hours of volunteer work) Save yourself the trouble and do not take this class. He makes this government class way more work than it has to be.
The class is easy and straightforward. Everything for the class is in the syllabus. Generous grading, and he doesn't take attendance. Good discussions, and never power points.
Wim's the best. He makes class interesting and he's really down to earth.

He's about the only liberal pols professor at KSU. You could all do with your minds being exercised by some other views than your parents'/pastors'.  He's a good teacher. He knows what he's talking about. He gives you a chance to explain why you disagree with him. Just read the book and participate. His class is managable.
Really cool guy and honesty fun to have a conversation with. The 10 page paper is really intimidating, definitely don't wait til the last few weeks to start on it.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Very laid back professor. He combines the context of textbook chapters with his class lectures. Get ready to read ALOT. Textbook is needed. You'll have to work for the A.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: You have to complete 8 volunteer hours. The textbook was only used to write the papers. He is a very liberal person (I took the class during election season), however he does not seem to let his views cloud his grading too much.

Great professor! He wants all his students to succeed and works with you to achieve that. He is open-minded and follows the, 'there is no right or wrong approach' as long as you understand the concepts he has taught and you're able to apply it you are good to go! Many papers, but follow the guidelines and you're almost guaranteed an A or B.
rating_tags: SO MANY PAPERS--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: The readings are great, very content heavy! I took a hybrid class, it was nice other than the 1 night a week we met. He talks a lot about his experiences, which is fine until he would drag the class on longer than it was supposed to be and disrespect our time. People have other classes, and children to pick up. I learned little by  going to class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: This is a really nice professor but he does require an 8 page paper and 8 hours of volunteer work. He lets you out of class a few days to work on this though. There is small writing assignments in almost every class so don't skip.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Inspirational--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: This is a great class and I'm glad to take him again. I couldn't believe there weren't ratings, so I'm already adding mine.
There were students who didn't do the reading, they had a hard time, but everyone that did the assignments passed.
